description: A simple example iOS application demonstrating Salesforce Mobile SDK integration with basic account and contact browsing capabilities. Perfect for learning and quick prototyping.

useCase.primary: Simple Salesforce iOS app for learning and prototyping
scenarios: Starting point for custom Salesforce apps
useCase.when: Use this template when you need a simple, working example of a Salesforce iOS app to learn from or build upon.

extensionPoints.name: Add SObject Support
extensionPoints.description: Add support for additional Salesforce objects beyond Account and Contact
extensionPoints.aiGuidance: Create new SwiftUI views following the AccountsListView pattern. Use the Salesforce RestClient to query your SObject. Add navigation to the new view from the main ContentView or InitialViewController.

extensionPoints.name: Customize UI
extensionPoints.description: Modify the user interface and add custom branding
extensionPoints.aiGuidance: Update SwiftUI views to match your design requirements. Add custom colors, fonts, and images to Assets.xcassets. Modify navigation patterns in ContentView.swift.
